section.text: *NOTE: Chapter 3A of this title was added by temporary legislation that will expire on October 22, 2021.*
section.heading: Continuation of basic telecommunications service.
section.text: A telecommunications service provider, as that term is defined by Chapter 20 of this title, shall not disconnect, suspend, or degrade basic telecommunications service to a customer that is participating in the federal Lifeline program for non-payment of a bill, any fees for service or equipment, or other charges, or for noncompliance with a deferred payment agreement.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (225 days) creation of Chapter 3A of this title, see § 3(k) of Public Emergency Extension and Eviction and Utility Moratorium Phasing Temporary Amendment Act of 2021 (D.C. Law 24-39, Oct. 27, 2021, 68 DCR 009487).
